intro: Scolopia cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a distinctive glandular surface. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. Scolopia cuneata is often found in shaded areas and can be identified by its unique leaf shape and glandular texture.
